#Text=Shawinigan
#Text=Shawinigan is a city of 50,000 people ( 2011 ) in the Mauricie region of Quebec .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Tourisme Mauricie , 1882 , Rue Cascade , Saint-Boniface-de-Shawinigan , ☏ +1 819-536-3334 , toll-free : +1-800-567-7603 .
#Text=M - F 08:30 - 12:00 and 13:00-16:30. Visitor centre .
#Text=History
#Text=In 1651 , the Jesuit priest Buteaux was the first European known to have travelled up the Saint-Maurice River to this river 's first set of great falls .
#Text=Afterwards , missionaries going to the Upper Saint-Maurice would rest here .
#Text=Before Shawinigan Falls was established , the local economy had been largely based on lumber and agriculture .
#Text=In the late 1890s , Shawinigan Falls drew the interest of foreign entrepreneurs because falls had the potential to become a favourable location for the production of hydroelectricity .

#Text=In 1899 , the Shawinigan Water & Power Company commissioned an engineering firm design a grid plan for a new industrial town on the banks of the Saint-Maurice River , providing the ground work for what would become Downtown Shawinigan .
#Text=In 1901 , the place was incorporated as a village , and gained town ( ville ) status a year later .

#Text=The hydro-electric generating station contributed to rapid economic growth and the town achieved several firsts in Canadian history : first production of aluminum ( 1901 ) , carborundum ( 1908 ) , cellophane pellets ( 1932 ) .
#Text=Shawinigan Falls also became one of the first Canadian cities with electric street lighting .
#Text=For decades , the local pulp and paper , chemical and textile industries created thousands of jobs and stimulated city growth .
#Text=Local prosperity was interrupted by the Great Depression in the 1930s .
#Text=Many plants were forced to temporarily reduce or stop their production , which left many residents jobless .
#Text=Many families needed public assistance to survive .
#Text=The City Council enacted a public works program to help families .
#Text=World War II put Shawinigan Falls , and many others cities in Canada , back on the path of economic recovery .
#Text=During hostilities , the windows of local power plants were painted black to prevent any possible German aerial attack .
#Text=By the early 1950s , the industrial growth in Shawinigan was such that the city offered the steadiest employment and the highest wages in Quebec .
#Text=As its working class gained economic ground and political leverage , Shawinigan became fertile ground for labour unions .
#Text=The workers of the Belgo pulp and paper plant went on strike in 1955 .
#Text=In the 1950s , Shawinigan Falls entered a period of decline that would last for several decades .
#Text=Technological improvements made industries less dependent on Shawinigan 's geographic location .
#Text=Many employers relocated to nearby larger cities or close down .
#Text=In order to offset the decline of the heavy industry , leaders have promoted the expansion of the local hospitality industry .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Shawinigan has a humid continental climate ( Köppen Dfb ) with cold and snowy winter coupled with mild to warm summers .
#Text=Precipitation is moderate to high year round , resulting in heavy winter snowfall , typical of Eastern Canada .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Shawinigan can be reached via Quebec Route 155 and Route 157 via Trois-Rivières .
#Text=Quebec Route 153 and Route 155 pass through Shawinigan .
#Text=Transport collectif du Haut Mauricie .

#Text=Service from Trois-rivières : adults , students , seniors : $ 10 , children 5-12 years old $ 5 ; service from La Tuque : adults $ 25 , students $ 15 , seniors $ 20 , children $ 10 , children 0-4 free
#Text=Get around
#Text=The entire downtown can be reasonably explored on foot .
#Text=Further away , the place is best explored by car .
#Text=RTCS .
#Text=Daily public transit service Saint-Georges-de-Champlain to Shawinigan-South .
#Text=$ 3 ( children 6 years old and under ) .
#Text=See
#Text=La Cité de l'Énergie , 1000 , avenue Melville , toll-free : +1-866-900-2483 .
#Text=A theme park based on local industrial history , with a 115 metre high observation tower opened in 1997 .

#Text=Since 2012 , it has been home to the Museum of Prime Minister Jean Chrétien , a venue similar to those operated by the U.S. Presidential library system and which focuses on the gifts received by the former Prime Minister of Canada ( 1993-2003 ) during his official duties .
#Text=Complete visit includes the Science Centre , the historic sector with the Museum of Prime Minister Jean Chrétien : adults $ 25 , seniors $ 24 , students ( 13 and over ) $ 20 , children ( 6-12 )
#Text=$ 12 , children under 6 free , family ( 2 adults , 1 child )
#Text=$ 55 , family ( 2 adults , 2 child ) $ 60 ; partial visit - the science centre or the museum : adults $ 19 , children ( 6-12 ) $ 10 , children under 6 free .
#Text=Shawinigan Cataractes , Centre Gervais Auto , 1200 , avenue des Cèdres , ☏ +1 819-537-6327 .
#Text=Quebec Major Junior Hockey League team .
#Text=Eglise Notre-Dame-de-la-Presentation ( Church of Our Lady of the Presentation ) , 825 Avenue Ozias-Leduc , ☏ +1 819-539-1888 .
#Text=Jun-Aug : M - Sa 10:00 - 17:00 , Su 11:00-17:00. A National Historic Site of Canada .
#Text=Ozias Leduc was a dominant figure of sacred art in Canada , dubbed the " Michelangelo of Quebec " .
#Text=The church features his work in a unique monumental decor , composed of murals , some of which represent the stages of discovery , colonization and industrialization of the Mauricie region .
#Text=A heritage work with a human dimension .
#Text=Adult $ 9 , senior 65 and over $ 8.50 , student ( from 13 years old ) $ 6.75 , child upto 12 years free ; prices include taxes .
#Text=Do
#Text=D'Arbre en Arbre , Parc de l'Ile Melville , 1900 Avenue Melville , ☏ +1 819-536-7155 , toll-free : +1-866-536-7155 .
#Text=24 Jun-25 Aug : daily 09:30 - 16:00 ; spring and autumn : available for group bookings .
#Text=Ziplines , suspended footbridges , Tarzan lianas , rope bridge .
#Text=Four aerial courses that total 87 suspended challenge-games , in rope and flexible cables .
#Text=Each course is adapted for different ages in terms of height and difficulty of games .
#Text=Adults $ 21 - 31 , youth $ 16 - 19 , children $ 12 - 16 ; families with 2 adults and 2 children get $ 1 - 2 off per person .
#Text=Parc national de la Mauricie ( La Mauricie National Park ) , 2796 Chemin de Saint-Jean-des-Piles , ☏ +1 819-538-3232 , toll-free : +1-888-773-8888 .
#Text=Mid-May to mid-Oct .
#Text=With 150 lakes , it 's a popular location for camping , canoeing and kayaking .
#Text=Operated by Parks Canada .
#Text=Daily fees ( 2018 ) : adult $ 7.80 , senior $ 6.80 , youth and children under 18 free , family/group $ 15.70 .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Marche Public Shawinigan , 2093 Avenue Champlain .
#Text=Th F 08:00 - 18:00 , Sa Su 09:00-17:00. Public market founded in 1902 .
#Text=30 merchants .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Mains $ 28 - 42.
#Text=Restaurant Cite d'Angkor , 880 Promenade du St-Maurice , ☏ +1 819-536-2488 .
#Text=Tu - Sa 12:00-20:00. Cambodian family cuisine overlooking the St-Maurice River .
#Text=Bring your own beer or wine .
#Text=Mains $ 13 - 18 , lunch $ 10 - 13.
#Text=Cafe Bucolique , 3240 Chemin Sainte Flore , ☏ +1 819-538-1735 .
#Text=W - F 10:00 - 16:00 , Sa Su 09:00-16:00. Coffee , soups , baked goods .
